current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to provide for a minimum Medicare payment rate for
			 primary care services furnished by primary care physicians.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
finds that the 2010 Report to Congress of the Interagency Access to Health Care In Alaska
			 Task Force found that—

text.#text:
there is a shortage of primary care Medicare providers in Alaska, a problem most severe in
			 Anchorage but evident in Fairbanks as well as in rural Alaska;

the main reason physicians give for not wanting to add new Medicare patients is their perception of
			 Medicare’s inadequate reimbursement;

the Medicare program has the lowest reimbursement level of the six primary payers of health care in
			 Alaska;

the typical physician can have a viable practice in Alaska without servicing any Medicare patients;
			 and

many in the provider community believe that a fair, adequate, and uniform Federal rate would
			 alleviate existing provider shortages
			 in Alaska.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end
			 the following new paragraph:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 1848(b) of the Social Security Act

header.#text: Minimum Medicare payment rate for primary care services furnished by primary care physicians

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the payment rate under the fee schedule
			 under this section for primary care services (as
			 defined in

) furnished in 2015 and 2016 by a physician
			 with a primary specialty designation of family medicine, general internal
			 medicine, or geriatric medicine may not be less than 100 percent of the
			 payment rate that applied in 2013 to such services and such a physician
			 under the
			 Medicaid plan under

for the State in which the service is
			 furnished.

text.#text: Notwithstanding any other provision of this section, subject to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
as of December 31, 2014, and as
			 subsequently modified).
